Seeing all worlds as dwelling in illusion, because they arise from the successive conditions of ignorance, existence, craving, and so forth;

Seeing that all past, present, and future are all illusory abodes, because they are born from the wisdom of inverted views such as the view of self;

Seeing that the birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, and distress of all sentient beings are all illusory abodes, because they are born from the unreal, false, and unreal discrimination of what was originally nonexistent but now exists;
Seeing that all buddha lands are all illusory abodes, because they are born from inverted thoughts and views of delusion;

Seeing that all bodhisattvas are all illusory abodes, because they are accomplished through the continuous manifestation of the Dharma of self-discipline, maturation of sentient beings, practices, and vows;

Seeing that all buddhas and the assemblies of bodhisattvas, their transformations, spiritual powers, and all their activities are all illusory abodes, because they are accomplished through the perfuming of various understandings, practices, vast vows, and wisdom.
Good man!

The nature of illusory realms is inconceivable. The two of us can only know this liberation of abiding in illusion. At that time, the youths Virtuous and Virtuous Lady, having spoken of their own liberation, used the power of inconceivable roots of goodness to cause Sudhana's body to quickly grow, becoming soft and lustrous. They said to Sudhana:
Good man!

It arises from the various wholesome roots and karmic rewards of the bodhisattvas, from the various powers of recollection, vows, mastery, and spiritual penetrations of the bodhisattvas, from the various skillful means of the bodhisattvas, and from the various merits and wisdom of the bodhisattvas.
Good man!
The bodhisattvas who abide in the inconceivable liberation universally manifest such realms for the sake of all beings with a mind of great compassion, and extensively gather such adornments.
Maitreya Bodhisattva MahÄsattva resides there in order to accept and mature his parents, relatives, and the masses of people from his birthplace;
In order to cause those who share the same rebirth, the same practice, and the same type of beings to attain firmness in the MahÄyÄna;

In order to reveal the liberation gate of the bodhisattvas for you;
It shows how bodhisattvas, in accordance with the power of their original vows, freely take birth everywhere;
It shows how bodhisattvas, with various bodies, appear before all sentient beings, revealing and awakening them, always teaching and transforming them;
It shows how bodhisattvas, with the power of great compassion, gather all the wealth of the world and give it to sentient beings without weariness;
It shows how bodhisattvas, cultivating all practices, know that all practices are devoid of characteristics;
It shows how bodhisattvas take birth in various places, yet understand that all births are ultimately without characteristics.

Go ask him how a bodhisattva practices the bodhisattva conduct, how to cultivate the bodhisattva path, how to learn the bodhisattva precepts, how to purify the bodhisattva mind, how to generate the bodhisattva vows, how to gather the requisites for the bodhisattva's aids and practices, how to enter the bodhisattva's stage of self-mastery, how to fulfill the bodhisattva's perfections, how to attain the bodhisattva's acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, how to perfect the bodhisattva's meritorious qualities and dharmas, and how to serve the bodhisattva's good and wise advisors.

Good man!

Those good and wise advisors can moisten your roots of goodness, can increase your resolve for enlightenment, can make firm your vast aspirations, can arouse all your wholesome actions, can increase your bodhisattva faculties, can teach you the unobstructed Dharma, can cause you to enter the stage of universal virtue, can cause you to abide in the bodhisattva vows, can cause you to practice the conduct of universal virtue, and can explain to you the merits accomplished through the immeasurable conduct and vows of all bodhisattvas, causing you to manifest the autonomous Dharma door of the bodhisattva universal virtue.
Good man!

You should not cultivate a single root of goodness, illuminate a single Dharma door, give rise to a single great vow, receive a single prediction, abide in a single forbearance, and think of it as ultimate;
You should not practice the supreme perfections with a limited mind;
You should not abide in the bodhisattvas' perfect ten grounds with a limited mind;
You should not purify all buddha lands with a limited mind;
One should not serve and make offerings to good and wise advisors with a limited mind.
Why is it so?
Good man!
